member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ICustomVirtualizingPanel
member.summary: Provides an interface that is implemented by virtualizing panels to allow their child elements to be brought into view.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration
member.summary: Provides an interface that specifies the properties to define in a configuration object that will be returned by a SpannedCellConfigurationSelector.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ICustomVirtualizingPanel.BringIntoView(System.Int32)
member.summary: Brings the element at the specified index into view.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to bring into view.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration.ContentStringFormat
member.summary: Gets the string that will be used to format the content in a SpannedCell.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets the DataTemplate that will be used to display the content in a SpannedCell.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration.ContentTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets the DataTemplateSelector that will be used to display the content in a SpannedCell.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration.HorizontalContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets the HorizontalAlignment of the content of a SpannedCell.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ISpannedCellConfiguration.VerticalContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets the VerticalAlignment of the content of a SpannedCell.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoFilterMode
member.summary: Value indicating how automatic filtering is performed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoFilterMode.None
member.summary: The data items will not be filtered.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoFilterMode.And
member.summary: The data items will be filtered according to all the filtering criteria defined by each column. If a data item matches all the criteria, it will be included.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoFilterMode.Or
member.summary: The data items will be filtered according to at least one of the filtering criteria defined by the columns. If a data item matches at least one criteria, it will be included.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers
member.summary: Represents the situations that will trigger an automatic scroll to the current item (or brought into view).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers.None
member.summary: The triggers described by the other flags will not cause the current item to be brought into view.

summary.para: The current item will be automatically brought into view if DataGridControl.CurrentItem or DataGridControl.CurrentColumn change, if the value of one of the properties of CurrentItem changes, or if a change occurs in the data source.

para.span: The current item will be automatically brought into view if the data source is replaced.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers.FocusChanged
member.summary: The current item will be automatically brought into view if a focus change occurs.

summary.para: The current item will be automatically brought into view if the sort configuration changes.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers.GroupChanged
member.summary: The current item will be automatically brought into view if the group configuration changes.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers.ViewChanged
member.summary: The current item will be automatically brought into view if the view ( DataGridControl. View) changes.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.AutoScrollCurrentItemTriggers.ThemeChanged
member.summary: The current item will be automatically brought into view if the theme changes.

summary.para: Any of the situations described by the other flags will trigger an automatic scroll to the current item. This is default value of AutoScrollCurrentItem and corresponds to the behavior found in versions 4.5 and earlier of the datagrid.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions
member.summary: Value representing under what conditions cell editors are displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.None
member.summary: A cell's editor is displayed only when the cell is being edited.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.RowIsBeingEdited
member.summary: All the cell editors in a row are displayed when one of the cells in a row is being edited.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.MouseOverCell
member.summary: A cell's editor is displayed when the mouse passes over a cell.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.MouseOverRow
member.summary: All the cell editors in a row are displayed when the mouse passes over a row.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.RowIsCurrent
member.summary: All the cell editors in a row are displayed when the row is current.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellEditorDisplayConditions.CellIsCurrent
member.summary: A cell's editor is displayed when it is current.

summary.para: Cell editors are always displayed.

para.strong: Including this value when setting the CellEditorDisplayConditions property will have a significant negative impact on performance.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellLabelPlacement
member.summary: Value indicating at which location the label will be placed, relative to the cell it belongs to.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellSpanningDirection
member.summary: Value indicating the direction in which a cell can span in order to merge with other cells.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellSpanningDirection.None
member.summary: The cell cannot be merged with other cells.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellSpanningDirection.Row
member.summary: The cell can be merged, but only with cells from adjacent rows that are in the same column.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellSpanningDirection.Column
member.summary: The cell can be merged, but only with cells from adjacent columns that are in the same row.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CellSpanningDirection.Both
member.summary: The cell can be merged with cells from adjacent columns and rows.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ClearFilterButtonVisibility
member.summary: Value representing the visibility of a clear-filter button, which can be displayed in each cell of a FilterRow.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ClearFilterButtonVisibility.Auto
member.summary: The clear-filter button is only visible when necessary (i.e., a filter is applied to the corresponding columns values).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ClearFilterButtonVisibility.Always
member.summary: The clear-filter button is always displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ClearFilterButtonVisibility.Never
member.summary: The clear-filter button is never displayed.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnDraggableStatus
member.summary: Value representing the expected drag behavior of a Column within the grid (or within its Merged Header, if any).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnDraggableStatus.Draggable
member.summary: The Column can be dragged to any position, except before any Column that has a ColumnDraggableStatus of FirstUndraggable, or after any Column that has a ColumnDraggableStatus of LastUndraggable.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnDraggableStatus.FirstUndraggable
member.summary: The Column cannot be dragged, it is locked with the first columns of the grid (or of the Merged Header it belongs to, if any), and no draggable column can preceed it.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnDraggableStatus.LastUndraggable
member.summary: The Column cannot be dragged, it is locked with the last columns of the grid (or of the Merged Header it belongs to, if any), and no draggable column can succeed it.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnWidthUnitType
member.summary: Value indicating the type of value a ColumnWidth objects contains.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnWidthUnitType.Pixel
member.summary: The value is expressed as a pixel.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ColumnWidthUnitType.Star
member.summary: The value is expressed as a weighted proportion in regards to the available space

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CommitMode
member.summary: Value representing when the CommitItems event of the DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView or DataGridVirtualizationCollectionViewSource will be raised.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CommitMode.PageReleasedFromMemory
member.summary: The CommitItems event will only be raised for a page that was modified when it is about to be released from memory.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.CommitMode.EditCommitted
member.summary: The CommitItems event is raised for each item as soon as its edit process ends.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment
member.summary: Value representing the alignment of the lines that connect the elements in a StaircasePanel together.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment.RightToBottom
member.summary: The lines are aligned right to bottom.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment.LeftToBottom
member.summary: The lines are aligned left to bottom.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment.RightToTop
member.summary: The lines are aligned right to top.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment.LeftToTop
member.summary: The lines are aligned left to top.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ConnectionLineAlignment.CenterToCenter
member.summary: The lines are aligned center to center.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridConnectionState
member.summary: Value representing the connection state when bound to a data source through a virtualizing data-grid collection view.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridConnectionState.Idle
member.summary: The connection is idle.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridConnectionState.Loading
member.summary: The data is being loaded.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridConnectionState.Committing
member.summary: The data is being committed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridConnectionState.Error
member.summary: The connection is in error.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridDragBehavior
member.summary: Value indicating expected drag behavior within the grid.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridDragBehavior.DragDrop
member.summary: Allow the selected rows to be dragged to a target host, such as Excel, in order to copy the data directly without performing an explicit copy/paste.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridDragBehavior.Select
member.summary: The underlying rows or cells will be selected when dragged. (e.g. Excel-like selection)

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridUpdateSourceTrigger
member.summary: Value representing the moment when data is to be written to the underlying data source.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridUpdateSourceTrigger.RowEndingEdit
member.summary: The source is updated when a row exits edit mode.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridUpdateSourceTrigger.CellEndingEdit
member.summary: The source is updated when a cell exits edit mode.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridUpdateSourceTrigger.CellContentChanged
member.summary: The source is updated when the content of a cell is changed. Using this value will cause the source to be updated at every key stroke.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DefaultGroupHeadersFootersType
member.summary: Value indicating which Headers/Footers will be used by default.

summary.para: No Headers/Footers are displayed.
(same behavior as the obsolete UseDefaultHeadersFooters = false)
A GroupHeaderControl is displayed.
(same behavior as the obsolete UseDefaultHeadersFooters = true)

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DefaultGroupHeadersFootersType.StatGroupHeaderControl
member.summary: A StatGroupHeaderControl is displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DefaultGroupHeadersFootersType.StatGroupHeaderControlWithGroupLabel
member.summary: A StatGroupHeaderControl is displayed, with a label with the value/name of the group.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DeletingSelectedItemErrorAction
member.summary: Value representing the action to take when an error occurs while deleting a selected item.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DeletingSelectedItemErrorAction.Abort
member.summary: The entire delete operation is aborted.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DeletingSelectedItemErrorAction.Retry
member.summary: Another attempt is made to delete the item.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DeletingSelectedItemErrorAction.Skip
member.summary: The item is skipped.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesConstraint
member.summary: Value representing the constraint applied to the distinct values when automatically filtering data items.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesConstraint.All
member.summary: No constraint is applied to the data items.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesConstraint.Filtered
member.summary: Distinct values are constrained to the currently filtered list of values.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesConstraint.FilteredWithAllFilters
member.summary: Distinct values are constrained to all filters currently applied to the grid (including filtering from a predicate and a FilterRow).

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesUpdateMode
member.summary: Value representing when distinct values used by auto-filtering are updated.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesUpdateMode.Manual
member.summary: Distinct values are manually updated.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DistinctValuesUpdateMode.Auto
member.summary: Distinct values are automatically updated.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers
member.summary: Value indicating what triggers will cause cells to enter edit mode.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.None
member.summary: No special triggers will cause cells to enter edit mode.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.BeginEditCommand
member.summary: Cells will enter edit mode when the Edit Command (default F2) is sent to the containing DataRow.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.ClickOnCurrentCell
member.summary: The current cell will enter edit mode when it is clicked.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.SingleClick
member.summary: Cells will enter edit mode when it is clicked.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.CellIsCurrent
member.summary: A cell will enter edit mode when it becomes current.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.ActivationGesture
member.summary: Cells will enter edit mode when the user performs the appropriate activation gesture for the current cell's editor.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.EditTriggers.RowIsCurrent
member.summary: All cells in a row will enter edit mode when the row becomes current.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FilterCriteriaMode
member.summary: Value indicating how filters entered into a FilterRow are applied.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FilterCriteriaMode.None
member.summary: Filtering through a FilterRow is disabled.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FilterCriteriaMode.And
member.summary: The data items will be filtered according to all the filtering criteria defined by each column. If a data item matches all the criteria, it will be included.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FilterCriteriaMode.Or
member.summary: The data items will be filtered according to at least one of the filtering criteria defined by the columns. If a data item matches at least one criteria, it will be included.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.InsertionMode
member.summary: Value representing how the insertion of data is handled in the grid.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.InsertionMode.Default
member.summary: The cursor remains at the current cell when edit mode ends.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.InsertionMode.Continuous
member.summary: The cursor returns to the first editable cell when edit mode ends.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ItemScrollingBehavior
member.summary: Value indicating how the data items in a grid are scrolled.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ItemScrollingBehavior.Deferred
member.summary: The data items are not scrolled until the scroll thumb is released.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ItemScrollingBehavior.Immediate
member.summary: The data items are scrolled immediately as the thumb is dragged.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.NavigationBehavior
member.summary: Value indicating how the focus navigates from one element to another in a grid.

summary.para: Navigation is not permitted in a grid. Elements cannot receive the focus.
The CurrentItem and SelectedItem/SelectedItems properties must be set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in order to reset them when the NavigationBehavior property is set to None.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.NavigationBehavior.RowOnly
member.summary: Navigation is row based. Cells will never receive the focus.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.NavigationBehavior.CellOnly
member.summary: Navigation is cell based.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.NavigationBehavior.RowOrCell
member.summary: Navigation is row based unless a cell in a row is clicked. If a cell is clicked, then navigation from cell to cell within the row is permitted. Once the focus is moved out of the row, navigation returns to row based.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PagingBehavior
member.summary: Value representing the paging behavior of a grid when the page-up and page-down buttons are pressed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PagingBehavior.TopToBottom
member.summary: The grid pages from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PagingBehavior.LeftToRight
member.summary: The grid pages from left to right.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PrimaryAxis
member.summary: Value representing which axis of a DataRow must be completely visible in order to determine which DataRow will receive the focus when the page-up or page-down buttons are pressed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PrimaryAxis.Vertical
member.summary: The vertical axis must be completely visible (see item 3 in the image below).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PrimaryAxis.Horizontal
member.summary: The horizontal axis ust be completely visible (see item 2 in the image below).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PrimaryAxis.Both
member.summary: Both the vertical and horizontal axes must be completely visible (see item 1 in the image below).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.PrimaryAxis.None
member.summary: Neither the vertical nor horizontal axes must be completely visible (see item 4 in the image below).

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ScrollOrientation.Horizontal
member.summary: The horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.ScrollOrientation.Vertical
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FlexibleCell
member.summary: Used by FlexibleRow to display the content of cells. A FlexibleCell will try to bind its Content property to the property that matches the column's name on the item that is set in FlexibleCell.DataContext. That item is usually the same as FlexibleRow.Content. For example, a FlexibleCell that is bound to the 'Value' column will try to bind its Content property to the 'Value' property that may be found on the FlexibleCell/FlexibleRow item. If such a property does not exist, the FlexibleCell will not display anything.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.FlexibleRow
member.summary: A row that can be put inside any header or footer that can display content that's not bound or related to the grid's data source. FlexibleRow uses FlexibleCell cells. Set the Content property to get the content to be displayed. By default, the FlexibleRow.Content value sets the FlexibleCell.DataContext property.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridCommands.ToggleDetailExpansion
member.summary: Represents the ToggleDetailExpansion command, which requests that the associated detail and its possible child details be collapsed if the root detail is expanded, and expanded if the root detail is collapsed. By default, Space or double-clicking the left mouse button.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridCommands.ToggleGroupExpansion

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridControl.AllowDetailToggle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end user can toggle the expansion state of the grid's immediate child details.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an effect occurs when the user attempts to perform a drag operation within the DataGrid. The default behavior allows selected rows to be dragged to a target host, such as Excel, in order to copy the data directly without the user having to perform an explicit copy/paste.
Drag can also be activated in order to select rows or cells within the DataGrid. See DataGridControl.DragBehavior property.

summary.para: Gets or sets a detail-configuration selector that will be used to select the appropriate configuration for a detail grid based on its information.
Gets or sets a value indicating the expected drag behavior within the datagrid. Default: DragDrop.

The datagrid allows users to select multiple items or cells using Left-Click and then dragging the mouse within the datagrid. This allows range selection to be performed without having to hold the Shift key on the keyboard.

To activate this feature, set the DataGrid's AllowDrag property to true and this DragBehavior property to "Select". The View must be a valid instance or subclass of TableView (ex. TableFlowView, TreeGridflowView).

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.AbortQueryAutoFilterDistinctValues
member.summary: Raised when a QueryAutoFilterDistinctValues event has been raised for a page of data that is no longer needed and whose corresponding AsyncQueryInfo object's EndQuery method has not yet been called, allowing the pending operation to be canceled and preventing useless processing on the data server.

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.AbortQueryGroups
member.summary: Raised when a QueryGroups event has been raised for a page of data that is no longer needed and whose corresponding AsyncQueryInfo object's EndQuery method has not yet been called, allowing the pending operation to be canceled and preventing useless processing on the data server.

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.AbortQueryItemCount
member.summary: Raised when a QueryItemCount event has been raised for a page of data that is no longer needed and whose corresponding AsyncQueryInfo object's EndQuery method has not yet been called, allowing the pending operation to be canceled and preventing useless processing on the data server.

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.AbortQueryItems
member.summary: Raised when a QueryItems event has been raised for a page of data that is no longer needed and whose corresponding AsyncQueryInfo object's EndQuery method has not yet been called, allowing the pending operation to be canceled and preventing useless processing on the data server.

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.QueryAutoFilterDistinctValues

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.QueryItemCount
member.summary: Raised every time the grid is loaded or refreshed or its state changes (e.g., new sorting or filtering criteria are applied), the total number of records in the underlying data source must be provided, taking into account any filters that are currently applied to the items. This event must be handled.

member.name: E:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.DataGridVirtualizingCollectionView.QueryItems
member.summary: Raised whenever new records are required, allowing the next batch of records to be fetched from the data source and provided to the grid. This event must be handled.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.GroupHeaderControl.PrepareDefaultStyleKey(Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Views.ViewBase)
member.summary: When deriving from the GroupHeaderControl class, PrepareDefaultStyleKey must be overridden in order to support dynamic style (view or theme modifications) changes.
member.param: The view from which to retrieve the current style key.

summary.para: This call is used only when the datagrid's group selection feature is enabled via the IsGroupSelectionEnabled property.

Since selection is often handled by the datagrid's low level hardware events, this method is called to identify if the event's target element should prevent any selection handling. (e.g. a MouseDown on a button displayed inside the GroupHeaderControl)
Be default, this call returns true if the target child is, or is within, an instance of the "System.Windows.Controls.Control" class.

A common scenario for overriding this method is when a subclass of Control was added in the GroupHeaderTemplate, and interaction with that child (e.g. a mouse click) should not prevent group selection to occur.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Converters.StatResultConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts the specified value using the composite format string specified as parameter.
member.returns: The converted value.
member.param: The result of a statistical function.
The target type is ignored by the StatResultConverter.

param.name: parameter
param.para: A composite format string. If a FormatProvider has been provided, it will be used in combination with the format string to convert the value (see also Composite Formatting topic in Windows SDK).
If parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), value will be returned unmodified.

Composite format strings use braces ("{}") to identify place-holders, which causes an issue when providing a format string to a StatResultConverter in XAML; therefore, the StatResultConverter supports square brackets ("[]") as a substitute for braces. For example, if normally {0:#0.0} would have been used, it would be replaced with [#0.0] when using a StatResultConverter. If braces are preferred, the format string must be preceded with a closing brace (e.g., ConverterParameter={}{0:#0.0}}).
param.div: When using square brackets, the 0: that represents the place-holder must be omitted otherwise an exception will be thrown.

member.param: The culture info is ignored by the StatResultConverter.

summary.para: Class that represents the Average statistical function, which is the measure of central tendancy of a set of values computed by dividing the sum of the values by their number; commonly called the arithmetic mean or the average.

Class that represents the Correlation Coefficient statistical function, which represents the quantity that gives the quality of a least squares fitting to the original data. Also known as cross-correlation coefficient.
Class that represents the Count statistical function, which is the result of a tally that reveals the number of items in a set.
Class that represents the Covariance statistical function, which is the measure of the strength of the correlation between two sets of random variates.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.CumulativeStatFunction
member.summary: Base class for statistical functions that accumulates the values required to calculate the result of the statistical function from the result of a child group.

summary.para: Class that represents the Geometric Mean statistical function, which is defined as the product of all the members of a set of positive data, raised to a power equal to the reciprocal of the number of members.

para.span: Class that represents the Harmonic Mean statistical function, which is defined as the number of elements to be averaged divided by the sum of the reciprocals of the elements.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.InvalidSourcePropertyNameException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when an invalid property name is specified in the SourcePropertyName property.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.InvalidValueException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when a statistical function encounters an invalid value during the calculation of its result.

summary.para: Class that represents the Maximum statistical function, which the highest value among a set of items.

Class that represents the Median statistical function, which is the middle number in a set of ordered data. If the set contains an even number of items, the arithmetic mean of the 2 middle values will be returned.
Class that represents the Minimum statistical function, which is the lowest value among a set of items.

Class that represents the Mode statistical function, which is the value that has the largest number of observations, namely the most frequent value or values. The mode is not necessarily unique, unlike the arithmetic mean.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.RootMeanSquareFunction
member.summary: Class that represents the Root-Mean-Square statistical function, which is the square root of the arithmetical average of a set of squared instantaneous values. The root mean square is also known as the quadratic mean.

summary.para: Class that represents the Standard Deviation statistical function, which is the measure of the degree of dispersion of sample or population data from the mean value.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.StatFunction
member.summary: Base class for statistical functions.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.StatFunctionCollection
member.summary: Contains a collection of statistical functions.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.StatResult
member.summary: Class that represents the result of a statistical function.

summary.para: Class that represents the Sum statistical function, which is the result of the addition of the values of a set of items.

Class that represents the Variance statistical function. The variance of a random sample or population variable is a non-negative number which gives an idea of how widely spread the values of the random variable are likely to be; the larger the variance, the more scattered the observations on average.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Stats.AverageFunction.#ctor

member.summary: Value that determines how or if the property on which the ViewPropertyAttribute is set can be accessed through a ViewBinding.

member.summary: The property on which the ViewPropertyAttribute is set cannot be accessed through a ViewBinding.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Views.ViewPropertyMode.ViewOnly
member.summary: The property on which the ViewPropertyAttribute is set will be accessible through a ViewBinding. If defined on a table-view property, it will not be possible to provide an alternate value for DetailConfigurations.

summary.para: The attached property on which the ViewPropertyAttribute is set will be accessible through a ViewBinding and will redirect to the appropriate DetailConfigurations for its value, when applicable.
If a detail configuration does not explicitly define a value for the property, the view's default property value will be used.
The attached property on which the ViewPropertyAttribute is set will be accessible through a ViewBinding and will redirect to the appropriate DetailConfigurations for its value, when applicable.
If a detail configuration does not explicitly define a value for the property, the view's default property value will NOT be used.
Represents the Aero normal-color theme.

member.summary: Represents a card-view layout.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Views.CompactCardView

member.summary: Represents a table-view layout in which rows are laid out horizontally as in traditional grid-like styles, but with animated smooth scrolling, sticky group headers and sticky master-detail master row and headers, full-column animated drag and drop reordering.

summary.para: Class used in DataGridControl templates as a replacement for the ItemsPresenter when a grid is in a table-flow view layout and will contain the data items as well as the items contained in non-fixed header and footer sections and whose containers are created from the associated CustomItemContainerGenerator.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Views.Theme
member.summary: Base class that represents a theme that can be applied to one or more views.

summary.para: Represents a table-view layout similar to TableflowView, in which rows are laid out horizontally as in traditional grid-like styles, but detail columns are aligned with the columns of the master, and one column displays data using a tree-structure.

Like TableflowView, it provides animated smooth scrolling, sticky group headers and sticky master-detail master row and headers, full-column animated drag and drop reordering. (See limitations below.)

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid.Views.DataGridScrollViewer.GetSynchronizedScrollViewerPosition(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the value of the SynchronizedScrollViewerPosition attached property for the specified dependency object (see Remarks).

returns.para: The SynchronizeScrollViewerPosition value for the dependency object.

item.description: The SynchronizedScrollViewer is scrolled to the top indicating that navigation in the fixed header or footer sections is permitted.
The SynchronizedScrollViewer is scrolled to the bottom indicating that navigation in the fixed header or footer sections is permitted.
The SynchronizedScrollViewer is scrolled to the left indicating that navigation in the fixed header or footer sections is permitted.
The SynchronizedScrollViewer is scrolled to the right indicating that navigation in the fixed header or footer sections is permitted.
The SynchronizedScrollViewer is not scrolled to one of its extremities indicating that navigation in the fixed header or footer sections is not permitted.

member.param: The dependency object from which the property value is read. By default, SynchronizedScrollViewerPosition.None.
